alert.note: Alert for Hale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hale County through 100 PM CDT... At 1222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Moundville, or 14 miles northeast of Eutaw, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moundville, Harper Hill, Moundville Airport, Phipps and Havana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
